heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 29 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (189°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.1 mm) and cloud levels (up 138 m) when compared to today.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; pleasant, mild temperatures. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
